New Records: Jasprit Bumrah took 3 wickets for 7 runs in his 4 overs, the second fewest conceded by an Indian in a men's T20I
Suryakumar Yadav scored 41 runs off 21 balls, the only batter with a strike rate above 150
Key Match Events: Jasprit Bumrah dismissed Hazratullah Zazai with a well-taken offbreak
Ravindra Jadeja nearly took a hat-trick with a caught and bowled and a run-out
Suryakumar Yadav hit three sweep shots for boundaries, including a six off Fazalhaq Farooqi
Rishabh Pant was dismissed lbw by Rashid Khan after a review
Virat Kohli was dismissed by Naveen-ul-Haq with a catch at long-off
Pre-Game Insights: The pitch was slow and offered purchase to spinners
India's strategy was to go hard at the bat, despite losing early wickets
Rohit Sharma played risky shots but showed faith in India's batting approach
Kuldeep Yadav was brought in for his spin expertise, which proved effective
Post-Match Reflections: India's coach highlighted the victory as a strong team performance
Suryakumar Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah were praised for their contributions
The match win was seen as a pivotal moment in India's World Cup campaign
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Bridgetown, a venue known for favoring batting first
Afghanistan's coach Jonathan Trott emphasized their ability to adapt to slow conditions
The match was part of the Super Eights stage of the World Cup
